text:
Ángel Peralta Pineda, known as Centauro de las Marismas (18 March 1926 – 7 April 2018), was a Spanish rejoneador and actor.
In 1954 he filmed alongside the rejoneador Bernardino Landete in scenes from the movie "La Princesa de Éboli" ("That Lady") by Terence Young and "Cabriola" in 1960, by Mel Ferrer.
He continued acting in the 1980s, fighting a few more years of seventy corridas.
He was awarded with the Gold Medal of Merit in the Fine Arts in 2013 by the Ministry of Education, Culture and Sport.
Peralta died of a respiratory failure on his farm in La Puebla del Río in Seville, Spain at the age of 92.

annotations.surface_form: Gold Medal of Merit in the Fine Arts
Ministry of Education, Culture and Sport
